intro: Agathelpis, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense, velvety pubescence. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. Agathelpis is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields. It is also known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and climatic conditions.
